solution_line_template: First find how many kids from Riverside High are rejected: {riverside_reject_percent_num}% * {riverside_kids} kids = <<{riverside_reject_percent_num}*{percent_factor}*{riverside_kids}={riverside_rejected}>>{riverside_rejected} kids

Then find how many kids from West Side High are rejected: {westside_reject_percent_num}% * {westside_kids} kids = <<{westside_reject_percent_num}*{percent_factor}*{westside_kids}={westside_rejected}>>{westside_rejected} kids

Then find how many kids from Mountaintop High are rejected: {mountaintop_kids} kids / {mountaintop_reject_divisor} = <<{mountaintop_kids}/{mountaintop_reject_divisor}={mountaintop_rejected}>>{mountaintop_rejected} kids

Then add the number of kids from each school to find the total number of kids: {riverside_kids} kids + {westside_kids} kids + {mountaintop_kids} kids = <<{riverside_kids}+{westside_kids}+{mountaintop_kids}={total_kids}>>{total_kids} kids

Then subtract all the kids who were rejected from the total number of kids to find the number who got in: {total_kids} kids - {riverside_rejected} kids - {westside_rejected} kids - {mountaintop_rejected} kids = <<{total_kids}-{riverside_rejected}-{westside_rejected}-{mountaintop_rejected}={kids_got_in}>>{kids_got_in} kids
